description: Extremely well done. I have been using it ever since it was developed. I do not remember how long ago

Powerful app, with a full suite of features for the serious backgammon player. Be sure to read a tutorial on how to set up the program to best suit your needs. Don't believe anyone who says the dice are loaded -- the ai is just strong!
summary: One of the Top Backgammon Games on Any System

description: Dice rolls are unfairly advantaged to the computer (multiple consecutive doubles, never misses an open blot, every game). Don't waste your time with this. Xgammon is much better.

This app frequently gives you die that are unhelpful, but very advantageous die to itself ! (I have been playing backgammon frequently for many years with Egyptian friends, so have sufficient experience to make this comment).
Die rolls crappy for me great for it. Enough said after over 1000 games.
summary: Well thought out app with inherent bias built in

description: Good potential but just leaves you in utter frustration. If you play, use manual dice - I actually managed to win a game to 7 points doing so, but nowhere near without.

Chances are as follows: whenever you accept a double from the AI, it immediately rolls doubles (most often fours for some reason). Very lazy AI writing spoils a great GUI, which is sad because most GUIs suck.
Could not figure out how to get game to roll after the first turn for each player.

Don't listen to reviews about built -in bias, it's simply not true. Good players (and bots) seem to get better rolls due to efficient checker use. There is simply no reason for a manufacturer to build in any kind of bias.

This is not quite to the standard of XG Gammon (extreme gammon) but that costs money and only works on windows platform. I am not a great player but am listed in top 50 UK players so am of reasonable standard...
summary: This is a great app which is free and can be used on linux

description: At first it might seem the dice are loaded, but they are not. You are just a scrub if you say so. This program comes with different difficulty levels (the default is really unforgiving), a tutor mode that tells you if you are going to do very bad / bad / doubtful moves. Activate it, think of your moves, and become better!
this is a waste of time. the app works, but the die are very biased. there is no way i could consistently roll advantageous numbers for me, but the computer play always does

It would be so nice to find a backgammon game that didn't cheat. Why not just go with what the roll is and not use what is the advantage. NO ONE is so consistently lucky that whenever a spot is uncovered it gets booted to the bar. You have never really played backgammon if you wanty to rationalize that your throws are always to your advantage.
The rolls are random -- people seem to forget that the odds are quite large of getting a particular number/roll. Do some home work
summary: Best free BG software out there!

description: The dice rolls are not rigged. Playing a machine is not the same as playing a human. Two human players will naturally make enough incorrect moves to make the dice rolls appear less biased. Computers can see much further ahead than a human can, and therefore, never lose equity on a move. The developer would have nothing to gain by rigging dice rolls. Funny that no one complains when dice rolls are in their favor.
To maintain sanity, PLAY MANUAL DICE ONLY.

This program plays backgammon better than even the strongest human being, and analyzes your matching againt it or against other players afterwards, points out every mistake made in detail so that you can rapidly improve and gives you a grade to evaluate your level of play (beginner, intermediate, world class etc).
It is similar to how chess programs works for instance.

The dice is not rigged, it uses standard random generators. If you are a world class level player you can expect to win more than 40% against it in a 7 point match in the long run. But if you are a not a world class level player, you will lose a lot more than that.

This program is such a good tool that people have used it to become among the best players in the world.

For completeness, there also exists a non-free program that is called extreme gammon which in many peoples opinion is even a better program than this. (Available for windows, to use it in linux you need to run it from wine).
summary: Great program for playing and learning program

description: Don't listen to the petty reviews and the haters. This taught me how to play and how to win. The simulation is basically perfect, the coaching it brilliant and it has a few simple themes for fun.

Strong engine, but I don't think it can be classified as skill when over 20 rolls the engine benefits from 6 doubles with a roll total of 178 while I roll 0 doubles with a roll total of 138. I could win all the time too if I were that lucky.
If you leave a single blot open, almost all of the time the computer miraculously rolls exactly the right dice to prevent you from coming on while running the game out to the end.
summary: As others have said, the bias kills the fun

description: Horrible interface and gameplay.
Like a great many computer backgammon programs the dice suck. The laws of probability do not exist in this game. Play with manual dice for a better game. The program is not bad for gameplay
summary: Random number gerators are not dice emulators

description:
When beginners play a very strong backgammon player they feel like they have bad dice, or even worse that dice are rigged.
Actually the main skill you learn as an expert player is minimizing you own bad dice and maximing your opponent ones. viceversa for good dice.

GNU Bg is one of the strongest engines out there. No need to complain.
summary: Bad reviews are sign for a strong engine

description:
This is an open-source program. Not a single one of these "rigged dice" gripers has the intellectual capacity to check the randomizing algorithm for themselves, let alone just RTFM for the "On Cheating" section in the documentation. 

Bottom line: It's free. It works. And it's right up there with XG as far as strength of analysis. 

Full disclosure: I may or may not have griped about the dice at one point in my life... 


..until I actually improved my game through practice - using this excellent FREE program.
summary: Have to LOL at all this b!tiching

description: Extremely 'unlucky' dice make this more satisfying to uninstall than it is to play.
When it rolls 5&1 7 consecutive times, or when it rolls 12 1's consecutively, you know that it is rigged.

Like many others... the machine rols 66 X 4 while I am stuck rolling the same 3 FACES, not pip counts (also the 3 faces system has 2 or more)

Your RNG is dirt. I was hopeful when I saw it. I feel better now that I am removing it.
RNG is terrible. Would not recommend.
This is game is not for beginners. It does not seem to roll the same for both parties. I simply did not enjoy playing at all. I rarely won.
Spielstärke ist Weltklasse, guter Tutormodus mit Bewertung alternativer Züge, Eingabe bzw. Editieren von Spielsituationen, es bleibt kein Wunsch offen

Als erstes bin ich von der Bewertung mit 5 Sternen überrascht, scheint nicht jemand zu sein der sich mit echten Zufallszahlen (random) oder Wahrscheinlichkeitsrechnung auskennt zu sein, denn mit den normalen Einstellungen direkt nach der Installation, hat wirklich nur das was der menschliche Spieler bekommt was mit Zufall zu tun. Und die Statistik zeigt natürlich auch nicht die Trefferquote der möglichen Zahlen für einen, wenn nicht DEN optimalen Zug... Gefühlte 8/9 von 10 sind 100% Bullseye-"Zufall"-Treffer!
Ich weiß dass es sehr schwer ist gute Spielzüge zu programmieren, Variablen ab zu wegen, Möglichkeiten erkennen zu lassen usw... Aber den kürzeren Weg einschlagen und höhere Treffer geben zu lassen um einen gut programmierten Gegner zu simulieren ist nicht die feine Art.

Hasard impossible ! Le jeu manipule les dés à sa faveur en général sauf si votre version ne plante pas (comme sur mon portable) si vous allez dans les options pour manipuler les dés en votre faveur (comme sur mon desktop). Les 3 options de sites de hasard pour contrôler les dés ne fonctionnent pas, ce qui est évident pour qui sait jouer au backgammon !
Trop énervant tellement l'IA a TOUJOURS des tirages monstrueusement favorables

Les niveaux de diffilculté se limitent à la "chance" aux dés de l'AI...
Il faudrait consulter des pros. pour améliorer tout cela. C'est difficile à coder mais quel challenge !
Много настроек. Не нравятся горячие клавиши. Каждый раз после хода надо Ctr+F нажимать. Неудобно. Был бы хотябы пробел или по времени выставить принятие хода.

Нормальные нарды, не поддаются. 
Жаль, что нет бесящей морды, которая вылезла бы в конце, приятнее было бы его обегорить, ну да ничего, и так устраивает.

Автолевелинг - и этим все сказано. Сложность достигается не уровнем искусственного интеллекта, и тупо зариками. Чем выше уровень сложности, тем вы реже побеждаете - все. Играя в настольные короткие нарды, я привык рисковать, но здесь рисковать нет смысла. Если вы открыли фишку - компьютер обязательно в нее попадет и это без вариантов. Исключение составляет только тот процент игр (согласно настроек сложности), в которые вам позволено победить. Да, частенько плохо играющие люди грешат на "подкручивание удачи", но тут это системная история, проверял специально.
Какое-то случайное начисление очков. Поставишь марс - полуишь 2 очка, а при победе еле-еле - можно и 24 отхватить.
